intro: Spergularia echinosperma subsp. echinosperma, commonly known as the sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb with succulent, fleshy leaves and small, pink or white flowers. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spiny fruit capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid environments. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh, dry conditions.
